DataElement.preferredName: Quality of Life Baseline Survey Paper Form Provide Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day and year that the paper form was provided for the quality of life survey.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Quality of Life Baseline Survey Paper Form Provide
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._A starting point to which things may be compared._A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people._A questionnaire or measure that is printed on a paper medium and filled out with a writing device._Supply what is desired or needed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Quality of Life Baseline Survey Paper Form
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:A starting point to which things may be compared.:A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.:A questionnaire or measure that is printed on a paper medium and filled out with a writing device.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
A starting point to which things may be compared.
A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.
A questionnaire or measure that is printed on a paper medium and filled out with a writing device.
